show.title: Dad & Step-Dad
show.headline: Sometimes raising a son takes two different guys

event.title: <show-title>Dad & Step-Dad</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wear your pleated khakis for this dad-tastic comedy with live Q&A
event.description:
Goatees, braided belts, pleated pants, and arguments about air mattress firmness take center stage in this hilarious indie comedy about an uncomfortable three-day weekend with a dad, a step-dad, and a 13-year-old named Branson. Named as one of the “41 Most Anticipated Films of 2023” by Esquire, DAD & STEP-DAD was shot in five days with a production budget of $18,000, a crew of seven, and improvised dialogue based on an outline.

Do you identify with the uptight paper plate designer dad, Jim, or the freewheeling gym-part replacement salesman step-dad, Dave? Weigh in with actors/co-writers Colin Burgess and Anthony Oberbeck during a live Q&A after the screening. Actor/co-writer Clare O'Kane will join them at the L.A., San Francisco, and Lower Manhattan Q&As. The Boston Q&A will include the full cast. The following moderators will be in attendance as well:

  • San Francisco: John Journey
  • Denver: Charles Gould (Jimmy Kimmel Live!)
  • Lower Manhattan: Sarah Sherman (SNL)
  • Los Angeles: Tipper Newton (How I Met Your Father)

show.title: Beetlejuice
show.headline: We dare you to say his name three times

landscapeHeroImage.altText: MV5 BMW Fl N2 Qy Nz At OT Bl YS00 NT Uw L Tk0 MW Et OGU3 MTA3 MT Zj Nj Ay Xk Ey Xk Fqc Gde QX Vy ND Qx Njcx NQ V1

event.title: <show-title>Beetlejuice</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Haunt along with the ghost with the most, babes
event.description: Un-live all the undead fun with spooky props galore and all kinds of delights for the Recently Deceased. BEETLEJUICE is the timeless tale of a ghostly couple and the troublesome “bio-exorcist” they employ to help scare away the living inhabiting their house. It’s megawatt Michael Keaton at his kookiest, Winona Ryder, Alec Baldwin, and Geena Davis at their dreamiest, and vintage Tim Burton from start to finish. This ghoulishly interactive screening comes with Miss Argentina sashes, shrimp keychains, BEETLEJUICE stickers, and even sticky eyeballs. Btw, if you feel an uncontrollable urge to Day-o (the banana song), that’s normal.

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Un-live all the undead fun with spooky props galore and all kinds of delights for the Recently Deceased. BEETLEJUICE is the timeless tale of a ghostly couple and the troublesome “bio-exorcist” they employ to help scare away the living inhabiting their house. It’s megawatt Michael Keaton at his kookiest, Winona Ryder, Alec Baldwin, and Geena Davis at their dreamiest, and vintage Tim Burton from start to finish. This ghoulishly interactive screening comes with Miss Argentina sashes, shrimp keychains, BEETLEJUICE stickers, and even sticky eyeballs. Btw, if you feel an uncontrollable urge to Day-o (the banana song), that’s normal.

show.title: Dark Harvest
show.headline: Sawtooth Jack is coming for one night only

event.title: <show-title>Dark Harvest</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Sawtooth Jack brings books for all the good boys & girls for one night only
event.description:
From acclaimed director David Slade (HARD CANDY, 30 DAYS OF NIGHT) comes DARK HARVEST, the twisted adaptation of Norman Partridge’s award-winning novel. Appearing exclusively on Alamo Drafthouse screens for one night only, it’s a gruesome Halloween ritual that’ll be gone by the stroke of midnight (or, you know, when the show lets out). Guests at our LA and NY screenings will even get a special Halloween treat – their very own copy of the Dark Harvest book, which is kind of like a movie but with thousands of words instead of moving pictures.

In a cursed town, the annual harvest becomes a brutal battle for survival. On Halloween 1963, Sawtooth Jack, a terrifying legend, rises from the cornfields, threatening the town’s children. Groups of boys unite to defeat the murderous scarecrow before midnight. Richie, a rebellious outcast, joins the run, motivated by his brother’s previous victory. As the hunt progresses, Richie makes a shocking discovery and faces a pivotal choice to break the relentless cycle.

show.title: The Craft
show.headline: Light as a feather, stiff as a board

event.title: <show-title>The Craft</show-title>
event.headline: Toast this witches' brew of supernatural Gen-X angst with a little bubbly
event.description: It would be easy to dismiss THE CRAFT as just another teen horror movie. But anyone who dismisses it as “just another” anything isn’t watching closely enough. Co-written and directed by filmmaker Andrew Fleming, the movie follows four high school outsiders (Fairuza Balk, Rachel True, Robin Tunney, and Neve Campbell) as they rally against bullies, racists, and awful men in the only way they know how – through witchcraft. From Doc Martens to Juliana Hatfield hits, THE CRAFT is chock-full of everything you want from a 1990s horror movie about witches. But it’s also about self-acceptance, empowerment, and friendship. Plus, spells that force Skeet Ulrich to jump out of a window. Join us in toasting this witchy ‘90s classic with plenty of champagne available to order.

event.title: <show-title>Mister Organ</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Join us for a live chat with journalist David Farrier
event.description: With as many twists and turns as journalist David Farrier’s new film has, you’re bound to have some lingering questions after the credits roll. Luckily, Mister Farrier will be joining us for a live Q&A to talk MISTER ORGAN. Are you still in contact with Michael Organ? What does he smell like? It’s all on the table, so join us for an enlightening night chatting about the most infuriating man in Auckland.

heroImage.altText: Event Category Web Hero Live QA 1920x1080

show.title: Mean Girls
show.headline: So Fetch!

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Lindsay Lohan, Amanda Seyfried, and Lacey Chabert in Mean Girls

portraitHeroImage.altText: Rachel McAdams and Lacey Chabert in Mean Girls

event.title: <show-title>Mean Girls</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: This party's gonna be so fetch
event.description:
There's a Regina George in every high school in America. That's precisely why MEAN GIRLS is so relatable, and also why it's so important. Comedic goddess Tina Fey based the screenplay on a non-fiction book about the social patterns of teenage girls and then harvested those authentic situations for priceless nuggets of hilarity.

This movie is funny because it's true to life, although the cast, including Fey, Rachel McAdams, Lizzy Caplan, Amy Poehler, and Lindsay Lohan (in the best role of her career), definitely had something to do with it. It's a portrayal of teen politics so accurate that it should be required viewing in every school across America. And given the stellar cast and hilarious script, it's easy to see why this movie so quickly earned a permanent place in our cultural lexicon, not to mention our everyday vocabulary.

It's packed with great quotes, from the elegantly simple, "Boo, you whore," to Damian's trademark, "YOU GO, GLEN COCO!", and at these interactive shows, you can celebrate all of these lines and more. Plus, we'll be handing out themed props, because the limit on fun at these screenings does not exist.

It's a night guaranteed to be even better than a cake made out of rainbows and smiles, so whether you're a Plastic, a Mathlete, or a Badass M.C., prepare yourself for a totally grool time.

show.title: The Unknown (1927)
show.headline: A criminal on the lam hides in a circus and falls for the ringmaster's daughter

event.title: <show-title>The Unknown (1927)</show-title> <event-type-title>Silent Movie Day</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the silent era of cinema with this Lon Chaney film
event.description:
The National Film Preservation Foundation and Silent Movie Day are thrilled to partner with Alamo Drafthouse for this presentation of THE UNKNOWN with a new score by Philip Carli.

With financial support from the NFPF’s Roger Mayer Legacy grant program, THE UNKNOWN has been restored by the George Eastman Museum, with approximately 10 minutes of previously lost shots and sequences taken from a Czech export print in the collection of the National Film Archive in Prague.

Proceeds from this screening will go to support the NFPF’s film preservation programs. Since its creation by Congress in 1996, the NFPF has provided preservation support to 337 institutions across the country to save more than 2,760 films.

Founded in 2021 and registered with National Day Archives, Silent Movie Day is an annual celebration of silent movies that anyone can take part in. SMD believes that silent film is a vital, beautiful, and often overlooked part of film history. Their goal is to advocate for its presentation and preservation.

show.title: Sorcerer
show.headline: An unstable path through hell's terrain

show.title: Scream (1996)
show.headline: "Do you like scary movies?"

event.title: <show-title>Scream (1996)</show-title>
event.headline: “Do you like scary movies?”
event.description: In 1996, the once innocuous question became synonymous with terror with the release of Wes Craven’s SCREAM. Based on an original script penned by struggling *homosexual* screenwriter Kevin Williamson simply titled “Scary Movie,” SCREAM became a surprise hit earning $173 million worldwide, a record for slasher films. SCREAM’s concept was deceptively simple: beautiful teenagers in a small northern California town receive menacing phone calls from a stranger before being killed by a man in a ghostly mask. Williamson’s script complicated the concept by including references to the classic slasher films of the '70s and '80s and self-aware characters who were well-versed in the plot points and cliches of the horror film genre. The meta-slasher film was born. AND IT’S SUPER QUEER. Featuring dialogue that only a gay person would write, SCREAM is quotable out the wazoo and it’s so damn sassy. “She has her own bubble butt boyfriend, Billy,” is a line in this film, folks. And don’t get us started about the sexual tension between Billy Loomis (Skeet Ulrich) and Stu Macher (Matthew Lillard) – those are two men who have had sex together, damnit. Sidney (Neve Campbell), Tatum (Rose McGowen), and GALE FUCKING WEATHERS (Courtney Cox) have all become queer feminist icons and for good reason – they exude power and poise in a way few horror film heroines are afforded the opportunity to. And Sweet Deputy Dewey (David Arquette), the bumbling himbo of our dreams, how could you not fall deep in gay love with such an earnest and goofy character? SCREAM is a perfect film and one of the queerest slasher films ever, and its legacy includes five very queer sequels and more to come. Don’t miss your chance to catch this horror classic on the big screen. Don’t fuck with the original, y’all.

eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 35mm
formats.headline: Film print projected using film projectors.
formats.description: The industry standard for theatrical film releases prior to digital cinema. Film print projected using film projectors.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages will be allowed at all screenings of this show.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
